member.name: M:Unigine.IG.CIGI.Connector.addSendPacketCallback(int,Unigine.CallbackBase4{})
member.summary: Sets a callback function to be fired right before sending a response to a request. This can be used to send additional data required by a host (e.g., velocities of the point of intersection for LOS/HAT queries which is useful in case of landing on a moving platform). A callback function has the following signature: (bool &ret, IG::CIGI::CigiIGPacket *response, IG::CIGI::CigiHostPacket *request, IG::IGIntersection *intersection) ret - boolean value indicating if the packet is to be sent or not; response - the packet to be sent; request - request for which a packet is to be sent as a response (can be nullptr); intersection - additional info on intersection (if necessary).
member.param: CIGI data packet opcode. One of the CIGI_OPCODE_* values.
Callback pointer. The callback function must have the following signature:(bool &ret, IG::CIGI::CigiIGPacket *response, IG::CIGI::CigiHostPacket *request, IG::IGIntersection *intersection)
member.returns: ID of the last added Send Packet callback, if the callback was added successfully; otherwise, nullptr. This ID can be used to remove this callback when necessary.

member.name: M:Unigine.IG.CIGI.Connector.removeSendPacketCallback(void)
member.summary: Removes the specified callback from the list of Send Packet callbacks.
member.param: Send Packet callback ID obtained when adding it.
member.returns: True if the Send Packet callback with the given ID was removed successfully; otherwise false.

member.name: F:Unigine.IG.CIGI.Connector.CIGI_MODE_RESET
member.summary: Reset mode of the IG. This is the IG's initial state upon start-up. When set to this mode, the IG will initialize/reinitialize the simulation. All entities that were instantiated during a previous mission will be destroyed. All environmental properties, views, components, and sensors will revert to their default settings. Any Host-defined rates, trajectories, and collision detection segments and volumes will be removed. The IG will only send the Start of Frame data packet to the Host and will ignore Host inputs except for the IG Mode attribute of the IG Control data packet. The IG will remain in this mode until directed otherwise by the Host or the IG's user interface.

member.name: F:Unigine.IG.CIGI.Connector.CIGI_MODE_OPERATE
member.summary: Operate mode of the IG. This is the normal real-time operating mode for the IG. All packets issued by the Host will be processed by the IG. The IG should not perform diagnostics in this mode.

member.name: F:Unigine.IG.CIGI.Connector.CIGI_MODE_DEBUG
member.summary: Debug mode of the IG. This mode is similar to the Operate mode but provides data and/or error logging and other debugging features to aid integration or troubleshooting of the Host and IG interface. Because of the overhead of these debugging features, the IG may not always operate in a hard real-time fashion.

member.name: F:Unigine.IG.CIGI.Connector.CIGI_MODE_OFFLINE
member.summary: Offline Maintenance mode of the IG. In this mode, the IG ignores all data from the Host and sends only Start of Frame packets. This mode can be activated only from the IG. Because the IG Control packets from the Host are ignored by the IG, the IG must be placed into Reset/Standby mode before the Host can initiate further mode changes.

member.summary: Returns the value of the Size X parameter specified in the packet. Determines the length of the environmental region along its X-axis at the geoid surface. This length does not include the width of the transition perimeter.
member.returns: Size X parameter value.

member.name: M:Unigine.CigiEnvironmentControl.getSizeY
member.summary: Returns the value of the Size Y parameter specified in the packet. Determines the length of the environmental region along its Y-axis at the geoid surface. This length does not include the width of the transition perimeter.
member.returns: Size Y parameter value.

member.name: M:Unigine.CigiEnvironmentControl.getRadius
member.summary: Returns the value of the Corner Radius parameter specified in the packet. Determines the radius of the corner of the rounded rectangle. The smaller the radius, the “tighter” the corner.
member.returns: Corner Radius parameter value.

member.name: M:Unigine.CigiEnvironmentControl.getRotation
member.summary: Returns the value of the Rotation parameter specified in the packet. Determines the yaw angle of the rounded rectangle.
member.returns: Rotation parameter value.

member.name: M:Unigine.CigiEnvironmentControl.getTransition
member.summary: Returns the value of the Transition Perimeter parameter specified in the packet. Determines the transition perimeter around the environmental region. This perimeter is a region through which the weather conditions are interpolated between those inside the environmental region and those immediately outside the perimeter.
member.returns: Transition Perimeter parameter value.

member.summary: Returns the value of the Destination Point Coordinate System parameter specified in the packet. It indicates the coordinate system relative to which the test segment destination endpoint is specified.
member.returns: Destination Point Coordinate System parameter value. The following values are supported:0 - Geodetic. The endpoint shall be given as a latitude, longitude, and altitude.1 - Entity. There are two cases:If Destination Entity ID Valid is set to Not Valid (0) than the endpoint shall be defined relative to the reference point of the entity specified by Source Entity ID.If Destination Entity ID Valid is set to Valid (1) than the endpoint shall be defined relative to the reference point of the entity specified by Destination Entity ID.

member.name: M:Unigine.CigiLosSegmentRequest.getRespCoordSystem
member.summary: Returns the value of the Response Coordinate System parameter specified in the packet. This value specifies the coordinate system to be used in the response.
member.returns: Response Coordinate System parameter value. The following values are supported:0 - Geodetic. The intersection point shall be reported as a latitude, longitude, and altitude.1 - Entity. The intersection point shall be specified relative to the reference point of the intersected entity.

member.name: M:Unigine.CigiLosSegmentRequest.getDestEntityValid
member.summary: Returns the value of the Destination Entity ID Valid parameter specified in the packet. Determines whether the Destination Entity ID parameter contains a valid entity ID.
member.returns: Destination entity valid parameter value. The following values are supported:0 - Not Valid. The destination endpoint shall be defined with respect to either the source entity (specified by Source Entity ID) or the Geodetic coordinate system as determined by the Destination Point Coordinate System parameter.1 - Valid. The destination endpoint shall be defined with respect to the entity specified by Destination Entity ID, only if Destination Point Coordinate System is set to Entity (1).

member.name: M:Unigine.CigiLosSegmentRequest.getAlphaThreshold
member.summary: Returns the value of the Alpha Threshold parameter specified in the packet. Defines the minimum alpha value (i.e., minimum opacity) a surface may have for an LOS response to be generated.
member.returns: Alpha Threshold parameter value.

member.name: M:Unigine.CigiLosSegmentRequest.getUpdatePeriod
member.summary: Returns the value of the Update Period parameter specified in the packet. Specifies the interval between successive responses to this request.
member.returns: Update Period parameter value. The following values are supported:0 - One-Shot request.>0 - update period. The value of n>0 indicates that the IG shall return response every nth frame.

member.name: M:Unigine.CigiLosSegmentRequest.getMaterialMask
member.summary: Returns the value of the Material Mask parameter specified in the packet. Specifies the environmental and cultural features to be included in LOS segment testing.
member.returns: Material Mask parameter value. Each bit represents a material code range; setting that bit to one (1) shall cause the IG to register intersections with polygons whose material codes are within that range.Material code ranges are IG-dependent.

member.name: M:Unigine.CigiLosSegmentRequest.getSrcPosition
member.summary: Returns Source Point position represented as a three-component vector of Source Latitude, Source Longitude, Source Altitude or Source X Offset, Source Y Offset, Source Z Offset parameters values specified in the packet corresponding to the Source Point Coordinate System parameter value.
member.returns: Three-component vector that defines Source Point position. The following values are supported:[Latitude, Longitude, Altitude] - if Source Point Coordinate System is set to Geodetic (0).[X Offset, Y Offset, Z Offset] - if Source Point Coordinate System is set to Entity (1).

member.name: M:Unigine.CigiLosSegmentRequest.getDestPosition
member.summary: Returns Destination Point position represented as a three-component vector of Destination Latitude, Destination Longitude, Destination Altitude or Destination X Offset, Destination Y Offset, Destination Z Offset parameters values specified in the packet corresponding to the Destination Point Coordinate System parameter value.
member.returns: Three-component vector that defines Destination Point position. The following values are supported:[Latitude, Longitude, Altitude] - if Destination Point Coordinate System is set to Geodetic (0).[X Offset, Y Offset, Z Offset] - if Destination Point Coordinate System is set to Entity (1). This offset may be relative to either the source entity or destination entity, depending upon the value of the Destination Entity ID Valid flag.

member.name: M:Unigine.CigiLosVectorRequest.getLosID
member.summary: Returns the LOS ID specified in the packet.
member.returns: LOS ID.

member.name: M:Unigine.CigiLosVectorRequest.getEntityID
member.summary: Returns the Entity ID specified in the packet.
member.returns: Entity ID.This parameter shall be ignored if Source Point Coordinate System is set to Geodetic (0).

member.name: M:Unigine.CigiLosVectorRequest.getRequestType
member.summary: Returns the value of the Request Type parameter specified in the packet. Determines what type of response the IG will return for this request.
member.returns: Request Type parameter value. The following values are supported:0 - Basic. The IG shall respond with a Line of Sight Response packet.1 - Extended. The IG shall respond with a Line of Sight Extended Response packet.

member.name: M:Unigine.CigiLosVectorRequest.getSrcCoordSystem
member.summary: Returns the value of the Source Point Coordinate System parameter specified in the packet. This parameter indicates the coordinate system relative to which the test vector source point is specified.
member.returns: Source Point Coordinate System parameter value. The following values are supported:0 - Geodetic. The point shall be given by latitude, longitude, and altitude. The vector, specified by Azimuth and Elevation, shall be defined relative to the Geodetic coordinate system.1 - Entity. The point shall be defined relative to the reference point of the entity specified by Entity ID. The vector shall also be specified relative to the entity’s coordinate system.

member.name: M:Unigine.CigiLosVectorRequest.getRespCoordSystem
member.summary: Returns the value of the Response Coordinate System parameter specified in the packet. This parameter specifies the coordinate system to be used in the response.
member.returns: Response Coordinate System parameter value. The following values are supported:0 - Geodetic. The intersection point shall be reported as a latitude, longitude, and altitude.1 - Entity. The intersection point shall be reported as an XYZ offset relative to the reference point of the intersected entity.

member.name: M:Unigine.CigiLosVectorRequest.getAlphaThreshold
member.summary: Returns the value of the Alpha Threshold parameter specified in the packet. Defines the minimum alpha value (i.e., minimum opacity) a surface may have for an LOS response to be generated.

member.name: M:Unigine.CigiSymbolSurfaceDef.getAttachType
member.summary: Returns the value of the Attach Type parameter specified in the packet. Determines whether the surface will be attached to an entity or a view.
member.returns: Attach Type parameter value: 0 (Entity) specified by the Entity ID parameter; otherwise, 1 (View).If the specified entity or view does not exist, this packet shall be ignored.

member.name: M:Unigine.CigiSymbolSurfaceDef.getBillboard
member.summary: Returns the value of the Billboard parameter specified in the packet. Determines the way of surface orientation.
member.returns: Billboard parameter value. The following values are supported:1 – Billboard. The surface shall be oriented such that the normal vector from the center of the surface is parallel to the viewing vector.0 - Non-Billboard. The surface shall be oriented in relation to the entity’s local coordinate system by the Yaw, Pitch, and Roll parameters.If the surface is attached to a view, then the IG shall ignore this parameter.

member.name: M:Unigine.CigiSymbolSurfaceDef.getPerspective
member.summary: Returns the value of the Perspective Growth Enable parameter specified in the packet.
member.returns: Perspective Growth Enable parameter: 1 (Enabled) if the perspective growth is enabled; otherwise, 0 (Disabled).

member.name: M:Unigine.CigiSymbolSurfaceDef.getOffset
member.summary: Returns the offset of the given surface as a three-component vector of X Offset, Y Offset and Z Offset or Left, Right and Top parameters specified in the packet.
member.returns: Three-component vector:[X Offset, Y Offset, Z Offset] - if the surface is attached to an entity. The values are relative to the entity’s reference point.[Left, Right, Top] - if the surface is attached to a view. The IG shall place it at this distance from the left edge of the viewport to the surface’s leftmost and rightmost boundary and from the bottom edge of the viewport to the surface’s topmost boundary respectively. This distance is measured as a fraction of the viewport’s width.

member.name: M:Unigine.CigiSymbolSurfaceDef.getRotation
member.summary: Returns the orientation of the given surface as a three-component vector of Yaw, Pitch and Roll parameters (for Entity-attached surfaces) and value of Bottom parameter (for View-attached surfaces) specified in the packet.
member.returns: Three-component vector. [Yaw, Pitch, Roll] values - if the surface is attached to an entity; otherwise, [Bottom, Y, Z].If the given surface is attached to View, than the last two components of the vector shall be ignored.

member.name: M:Unigine.CigiSymbolSurfaceDef.getWidth
member.summary: Returns the value of the Width parameter specified in the packet.
member.returns: Width parameter value in the [0.0; 180.0] range for surfaces which are entity-attached Billboards with disabled Perspective Growth; the value is greater than 0 for entity-attached Billboards with enabled Perspective Growth and Non-Billboards.

member.name: M:Unigine.CigiSymbolSurfaceDef.getHeight
member.summary: Returns the value of the Height parameter specified in the packet.
member.returns: Height parameter value in the [0.0; 180.0] range for surfaces which are Billboards, Entity-attached with disabled Perspective Growth; the value is greater than 0 for entity-attached Billboards with enabled Perspective Growth and Non-Billboards.

member.name: M:Unigine.CigiVolumeNotify.setCollisionType(int)

member.name: M:Unigine.CigiWaveControl.getRegionID
member.summary: Returns the Environmental region ID specified in the packet.
member.returns: Entity ID if Scope is set to Entity (2).Region ID if Scope is set to Regional (1).This value will be ignored if Scope is set to Global (0).

member.returns: Wave ID parameter value.

member.summary: Returns the value of the Wave Enable parameter specified in the packet.
member.returns: Wave Enable parameter: 1 - wave is enabled and will contribute to the shape of water's surface; otherwise, 0.

member.name: M:Unigine.CigiWaveControl.getScope
member.summary: Returns the value of the Scope parameter specified in the packet. Determines whether the wave is defined for global, regional, or entity-controlled maritime surface conditions.
member.returns: Scope parameter value. The following values are supported:0 - Global1 - Regional2 - Entity

member.name: M:Unigine.CigiWaveControl.getBreaker
member.summary: Returns the value of the Breaker Type parameter specified in the packet.
member.returns: Breaker Type parameter value. The following values are supported:0 - Plunging. Plunging waves peak until the wave forms a vertical wall, at which point the crest moves faster than the base of the breaker. The wave shall then break violently into the wave trough.1 - Spilling. Spilling breakers break gradually over a great distance. White water shall form over the crest, which spills down the face of the breaker.2 - Surging. Surging breakers advance toward the beach as vertical walls of water. Unlike with plunging and spilling breakers, the crest shall not fall over the front of the wave.

member.name: M:Unigine.CigiWaveControl.getHeight
member.summary: Returns the value of the Wave Height parameter specified in the packet.
member.returns: Wave Height parameter value.

member.name: M:Unigine.CigiWaveControl.getLength

member.returns: Wavelength parameter value.

member.name: M:Unigine.CigiWaveControl.getPeriod
member.summary: Returns the value of the Period parameter specified in the packet. Determines the time required for one complete oscillation of the wave.
member.returns: Period parameter value.

member.name: M:Unigine.CigiWaveControl.getWindDirection
member.summary: Returns the value of the Wind Direction parameter specified in the packet. Determines the direction in which the wave propagates.
member.returns: Direction parameter value in the [0; 360] range.

member.name: M:Unigine.CigiWaveControl.getOffset
member.summary: Returns the value of the Phase Offset parameter specified in the packet. Determines the phase offset of the wave.
member.returns: Phase Offset parameter value in the [-360; 360] range.

member.name: M:Unigine.CigiWaveControl.getLeading

member.name: M:Unigine.CigiWeatherControl.getTransition
member.summary: Returns the value of the Transition Band parameter specified in the packet. Determines the height of a vertical transition band both above and below the weather layer. This band produces a visibility gradient from the layer’s visibility to that immediately outside the transition band.
member.returns: Transition Band parameter value.

member.summary: Returns the value of the Aerosol Concentration parameter specified in the packet. Determines the concentration of water, smoke, dust, or other particles suspended in the air.
